column5: Hello  Thought that I would share my trip to Alberta,  I have to go for some family matters but managed to find tons of free time to fish THE BOW, THE OLDMAN, 2 National Parks and tons of mountain lakes and streams.   Tons of fish caught ranging from CUTTHROATS, BULL TROUT, RAINBOWS,MOUNTAIN WHITEFISH and some others I didnt know what they were.  All were caught and released,  My guide didnt like taking pics of fish or even handling them so we used a release tool,  so that they can fight another day..  The pics are mostly scenery shots of the areas I fishined  BANIFF NATIONAL PARKS HERE I WAS USING A 10ft 7wt rod and swinging and stripping large flies like BOW RIVER BUGGERS     WATERTON NATIONAL PARK GREAT mountain view,  this area has about 100 stream that flow into this lake...  Hiking to a little gem spot    Tons of wildlife,  I saw Mule Deer, Mountains sheep (long horn) moose, coyotes, bears, elk, white tale deer. tons of hawks, eagles, first time ever a MAG-PIE  also I thought I was going crazy when I saw this Bird  a PELICAN  I talked to a warden and he said they fly here and usually dont make it back...      This is one of my fav shot,  its me fishing a stream 2 hours in the interior of CANMORE (atv's).  It was just amazing,  the fish were stacked up like cord wood, it was almost to easy...    More to come when I get my other camera out of luggage  Hope you enjoyed It  Dave
Amazing shots.  Looking forward to more of these.
wow man I can't believe there are no fish pics LOL looks so amazing. I wish I was there. But no fish pics....what the hell. I dont believe you caught anything. No pics no proof ahahahah
Stunning scenery dmasse, like someone else said...look forward to more pics.
that is awesome man, can't wait for the rest of the pics!

Awesome pics man!  I cant wait until the day I get to do that! I am planning on fishing the BOW when I am out there in November for a conference but something tells me I wont be in short sleves at that time of year
Wow... looks absolutely beautiful up there.  I've got to go to Alberta one of these days.
That's some mighty fine looking sheep!!

Ah, the good old Bow River, I've fished it many times.  Canmore is such a beautiful place isn't it?  Did you see the three sisters while you were there?  (Get your minds out of the gutter, its a mountain range   )  Thanks for the photos  Joey
Beauty shots!
Very nice, thanks for sharing...
Fancy photography, bring on the fish porn!!
those are some real nice shots
Thanks for sharing your trip and pics with us Dave. Some excellent shots.
Nice scenery pic BUT No Photo-No Phish!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
love the first shot with the bend in the fly rod, in what would normally be the wrong direction, i dont think ive every seen that in a photo, or ever noticed anyway
Makes one want, to just set up camp and live there.  Thanks for sharing Dave.
your last pic is simply amazing and depicts fishing's solitude to it finest...its an image burned in every fishermans mind ( even when standing in a crowded river in Missisauga  Amazing trip!!
Great pics Dave, breathtaking views there.  Looks like you had an awsome trip.
those great pic's are more reasons i gotta see that country first-hand . beautiful. thanks and look forward to seeing more
great pics...  are u sure you weren't just "POSING " though ?  Where is the fish ?
